---
category: news
title: "Neuroligin 2 regulates absence seizures and behavioral arrests through GABAergic transmission within the thalamocortical circuitry"
excerpt: "Neuroligins are postsynaptic cell adhesion molecules that are involved in synapse function and autism spectrum disorder. The authors show that NLG2-mediated GABAergic transmission at the thalamic reticular nucleus-thalamic circuit is a common mechanism underlying epileptic seizures and ASD."
publishedDateTime: 2020-07-27T09:20:00Z
webUrl: "https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-020-17560-3"
